1. The training rule on swaying the body

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kāyappacālakaṁ antaraghare gacchanti kāyaṁ olambentā …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū kāyappacālakam antaraghare gacchanti kāyam olambentā pe
translated: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying their bodies while walking in inhabited areas. …

analyzed: na kāyappacālakam antaraghare gamissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not sway my body while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not sway one’s body while walking in an inhabited area.
One should walk with one’s body well controlled.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca kāyappacālakaṁ antaraghare gacchati kāyaṁ olambento, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca kāyappacālakam antaraghare gacchati kāyam olambentaḥ āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways his body while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
